title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion - Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion - Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the UI is replacing more code than expected. This behavior can be observed when adding a parameter to the 'baz' method call in the 'bar' method. Currently, the code is replaced up until the end of the current identifier. The desired behavior is to replace the code until the cursor location where the code assist was triggered.

The code should be changed to:
baz(x.foo()x.foo())

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list.
5. Select 'foo()'.

Expected behavior:
The code replacement should be limited to 'baz(x.x.foo())' when using code assist.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature is replacing code up until the end of the current identifier instead of the cursor location where code assist was triggered when adding a parameter to the 'baz' method call.
EB: The code is changed to 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())'. The code replacement should be limited to 'baz(x.x.foo())' when using code assist.
SR:
Change the 'baz' call to 'baz(x.x.foo())'.

Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
Press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
Type 'f' to filter the list.
Select 'foo()'.
